body: [[Chest hair]] peeking out from the top of a characters clothes. Often, but not always, accompanied by [[pectoral cleavage]].

title: thick_chest_hair
body: Thick patches of [[chest hair]] covering most of the characters chest. In stylized depictions it may have the same consistency as fur or head hair.

title: excessive_armpit_hair
body: Cartoonishly thick [[armpit hair]]. It roughly the same thickness as the hair on a character's head.

title: thick_arm_hair
body: [[Arm hair]] that is thick and dark. Might completely cover all or a portion of the arm and be visible from a distance. (post #7463340).

title: sparse_arm_hair
body: [[Arm hair]] lacking volume. Might be drawn as only a few lines (post #8185261).

title: testicle_hair

title: powder_(arcane)
body:
What [[Jinx (League of Legends)|Jinx]] from [[Arcane: League of Legends]] was known as before she renamed herself. [Spoilers]While her sister [[Vi (League of Legends)|]] still calls her by her original name, all other characters now call her Jinx.[/spoilers]

The tag should be used when Jinx is seen as a [[child]].

title: let_me_solo_her
body:
Also known as [b]Klein Tsuboi[/b], a legendary [[Elden Ring]] [[tarnished (elden ring)|player]] with a summon sign outside [[malenia blade of miquella|Malenia]]'s boss fight.  Fights naked except for a [[pot on head|pot on their head]].  As his name suggests, is capable of soloing a co-op boosted Malenia without assistance from the summoner.

A screenshot of "this":[https://www.reddit.com/r/Eldenring/comments/u22zpa/heres_to_an_absolute_legend_let_me_solo_her/] particular Reddit post started the legend, and a screenshot of it shared outside of the website made it popular overrall.

On May 10th, 2022, Let Me Solo Her has soloed Malenia for the 1000th time.

With the release of [[Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree]], they changed their player name to Let Me Solo Them, facing the DLC's most challenging boss, [spoiler][[Promised Consort Radahn]][/spoiler].

h4. See also

* "Youtube Video":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IqN2phpMWno]

title: powder_(alternate_timeline)_(arcane)
body: [Spoiler]In an alternate timeline, where [[Arcane Vi|Vi]] died and the events of [[Arcane: League of Legends|Arcane]]'s first season never occured, [[Powder (Arcane)|Powder]] never turned to villainy. In this timeline, she has shorter hair and a pink hair streak.[/spoiler]

It consists of a [[black shirt]] with a [[frilled shirt collar|frilled collar]], a [[see-through clothes|see-through]] section on her neckline and [[long sleeves|long]] [[see-through sleeves]], a red [[neck ribbon]], a [[long skirt|long]] [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[red skirt]] with a [[cross-laced slit|cross laced]] [[side slit]] held with a [[red sash]] and an [[orange skirt]] underneath, [[grey socks|grey]] [[ribbed socks|ribbed]] [[ankle socks]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. She also has an optional [[red cloak|red]] [[hooded cloak]] and a [[black headwear]] [[flat cap]]. Her [[head wings]] are now folded down into the rest of her hair giving the impression she no longer has them.

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume

title: hindenburg_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the German heavy cruiser [i]Hindenburg[/i], as part of a collaboration with [[World of Warships]]. 
Character design by [[Yunsang]], voiced by [[Matsui Eriko]].

She has [[absurdly long hair|absurdly long]] [[red hair]] with [[ahoge]] and [[hair intakes]], [[red eyes]], [[large breasts]], [[pointy ears]], [[demon wings]], and [[demon tail|tail]]. Her outfit consists of a black [[crop top]] exposing her [[underboob]]s, [[pleated dress|pleated]] [[black dress]], [[black pantyhose]], [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]], and a [[black hairband]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of two of her four planned 203 mm triple gun mounts on a dragon-like automaton. 

The fourth shipgirl introduced as part of the sixth wave of Priority Ships, [i]Hindenburg[/i] is basically an upscaled version of [[Roon (Azur Lane)|]], using the same 203 mm triple mounts, but her hull is based off the [i]Admiral Hipper[/i]-class to accommodate an extra fourth gun mount and four 533 mm quad [[torpedo tubes]]. Another note is that her size and displacement is similar to a battleship.

h4. Skins

* !post #6489487: Default
* !post #7005180: [[Hindenburg (Delirious Duel) (Azur Lane)|Delirious Duel]]
other_names: ヒンデンブルク(アズールレーン)

title: e3_tsubasa
body:
The E3 series (E3系) is a Japanese [[Shinkansen]] [[high-speed train]] type built for Komachi services which commenced on 3 June 1997, coinciding with the opening of the new Akita Shinkansen "mini-shinkansen" line, a regular line between Morioka and Akita re-gauged to 1,435 mm (4 ft 8+1⁄2 in) standard gauge. Later versions of the E3 series were also introduced for use on Yamagata Shinkansen Tsubasa services. Both "mini-shinkansen" lines join the Tohoku Shinkansen, providing services to and from Tokyo.

title: wrecking_crew
body:
A 1985 puzzle game released for the [[NES|Nintendo Entertainment System]] and the second [i]Wrecking Crew[/i] game. It's based on the arcade game of the similar name that released a year prior, [i]Vs. Wrecking Crew[/i], but focuses more on a single player puzzle game aspect than the competitive multiplayer of it's arcade counterpart. 

[[Mario]] & [[Luigi]] are demolition men who are tasked to destroy all the breakable walls in a given level to clear the stage (called "Phases"). They must find a way to accomplish this while navigating the roaming monsters hot on their tail, frequent fireballs spawning and a rival demolition man [[Foreman_spike|Spike]] trying to break the wall they're near to knock them down.

A stage based on this game was added to [i][[Super Smash Bros.]] for Wii U[/i].

title: daicon_iv
body:
An animated short produced by the [[Daicon]] Film group for the 22nd Annual Japan National SF Convention, [b]Daicon IV[/b], in 1983. 

The short they produced for this convention started with a recap of the original short [[Daicon III]] and continued the adventures of the protagonist, who now becomes the [[Daicon Bunny Girl]]. The quality of the animation in this short clip was much higher and impressive than that of the previous film.

The action was set to the song "Twilight" from the band [i]Electric Light Orchestra[/i]. The use of this song, however, was unlicensed, preventing the short from being officially released on DVD, making the limited laserdisc release of the Daicon shorts very rare and highly sought after.

This short firmly established Daicon Film as a talented new anime studio. The studio changed its name to [[Gainax]] two years later.

h4. Links

* "The opening for Daicon IV":[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-840keiiFDE]
** "AI upscale (2020)":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yDN68LxWW-8]

h4. See also

* [[Daicon 33]]

title: daicon_iii
body:
An animated short for the 20th Annual Japan National SF Convention, also known as [b]Daicon III[/b], held in 1981 in Osaka, Japan. 

It was created by a studio formed in the early 1980s called [[Daicon]] Film. Daicon film would eventually become [[Gainax]] Studio a few years later.

While this animated short was ambitious, its animation was rough and low-quality.

[b]"The opening for Daicon III":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CQjruwkyOaU
[/b]

h4. See also

* [[Daicon IV]]
* [[Daicon 33]]
* [[Daicon Bunny Girl]]

title: csx_corporation
body:
CSX Corporation is an American holding company focused on rail transportation and real estate in North America.  Their subsidiary CSX Transportation is a freight railroad operating in the eastern United States and the Canadian provinces of [[Ontario]] and [[Quebec|Québec]].

CSX and its chief competitor, the Norfolk Southern Railway, have a duopoly on the transcontinental freight rail lines in the Northeastern and Southern United States

title: poutine
body:
A dish of [[french fries]] and cheese curds topped with a brown [[gravy]].  It emerged in [[Quebec|Québec]], [[Canada]] in the 1950's, though it's exact origin remains unknown.  It since gained popularity in the rest of Canada becoming a national comfort food.

In the US a similar dish called Disco Fries exists, originating from the US state of New Jersey.  The primary difference between it and poutine is that it is made using shredded mozzarella cheese instead cheese curds.  The dish's exact origin date is unknown, but it was named in the 1970's after the late night customers coming in from disco clubs.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Poutine":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poutine]

title: godspeed_you!_black_emperor
body: Godspeed You! Black Emperor (sometimes abbreviated to GY!BE) is a Canadian experimental music collective which originated in Montreal, [[Quebec|Québec]] in 1994. The group releases recordings through Constellation, an independent record label also located in Montreal.

title: nigel_ng_(uncle_roger)
body: [b]Nigel Ng[/b] is Malaysian comedian and YouTuber who is famous for his alter-ego [b]Uncle Roger[/b], a stereotypical middle-aged Chinese uncle who mocks and critique cooking videos that do poor recreations of Chinese and Asian food. Roger also praises those who do good recreations by giving them the title "Uncle and Aunty", instead of "Niece and Nephew".

title: praying_mantis
body:
A [[bug]] in the Mantidae family, having long bodies and fore-limbs closed together in a prayer-like stance, hence their name. Mantises protect themselves with camouflage, and some species spread their wings and forearms in a threatening stance.

* !post #7527665: Profile

title: ayunda_risu_(new_year)
body:
The 5th/New Years [[official alternate costume|costume]] for [[hololive Indonesia]]'s [[Ayunda Risu]].

It consists of a [[pink kimono|pink]] [[fur-trimmed kimono|fur-trimmed]] [[floral print|floral]] [[floral print kimono|print]] [[print kimono|kimono]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[wide sleeves]] [[white socks|white]] [[tabi]] and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[okobo]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is [[long hair]] decorated with a [[tsumami kanzashi]] on one side and a [[tassel hair ornament]] with a small [[hair bow|bow]] and a [[hair flower|flower]] on the other.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7365012: Profile

title: ayunda_risu_(cyberpunk)
body:
The 4th/[[Cyberpunk]] [[official alternate costume|costume]] for [[hololive Indonesia]]'s [[Ayunda Risu]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/8103x/status/1585053541403889664].

It consists of a [[two-tone jacket|two tone]] and [[black jacket]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[pink sleeves|pink]] [[raglan sleeves]] anda [[popped collar]], a [[black_shirt|black]] [[crop top|black crop]], [[chest harness]] with an [[underbust]] [[chest belt]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] a [[black pantyhose]] a [[thigh strap]] on left left leg and black [[leg ribbon|ribbon]] wrapped around her lower right leg and [[pink footwear|pink]] sneakers. She also has an optional [[pink-tinted eyewear|pink-tinted]] [[head-mounted display]] and a [[headset]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is [[short hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[colored inner hair]] and [[streaked hair|streaks]]/[[colored tips]] decorated with a bateri charge indicator-shaped [[hairclip]] on one side and an [[x hair ornament|x-shaped]] one on the other.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7365011: Profile

title: tuatara
body: Tuatara (Sphenodon punctatus) are reptiles endemic to New Zealand. Although resembling most [[lizard]]s, they are part of a distinct lineage, the order Rhynchocephalia. Their name derives from the Māori language, and means "peaks on the back". The single species of tuatara is the sole surviving member of its order, which originated in the Triassic period around 250 million years ago and which flourished during the Mesozoic era.

title: turtle
body:
[b]Turtles[/b] are reptiles famed for their slow pace, longevity and [[shell]]s. Most turtles are able to retract into their shells for protection.

Turtles are occasionally depicted as [[oversized animal|massive]] in size, sometimes [[island turtle|large enough]] to carry [[city|cities]], or even worlds.

title: pterosaur
body: Flying reptiles of the Mesozoic. Not a [[dinosaur]].

title: alligator
body: A very large reptile, a [[scales|scaly]] quadruped with a long [[crocodilian tail|tail]] and very powerful jaws. Often seen in the southeastern [[United states|United States]].

title: ano_hi_mita_hana_no_namae_wo_bokutachi_wa_mada_shiranai.
body:
あの日見た花の名前を僕達はまだ知らない。, lit. [i]"We still don't know the name of the flower we saw that day."[/i], abbreviated as [i]AnoHana[/i].

A Spring 2011 anime by [[A-1 Pictures]] and directed by Nagai Tatsuyuki, to be released in America as "Anohana: The Flower We Saw That Day".

Five years have passed since the Super Peace Busters, a group of six friends, dissolved following the tragic death of one of their own, [[Honma Meiko]]. Now [[hikikomori|a reclusive teen]], the group's de facto leader [[Yadomi Jinta]] gets a visit from Meiko's ghost, urging him to reassemble the gang to help her fulfill a wish so she may pass onto the afterlife. Slowly, they bring back the rest of the group: [[Anjou Naruko]], who remained in touch with Jinta as a classmate, [[Matsuyuki Atsumu]], a handsome top-scorer and his schoolmate [[Tsurumi Chiriko]], and [[Hisakawa Tetsudou]], a wanderer who takes part-time jobs to fund his travels.

h4. Characters

* [[Yadomi Jinta|Yadomi "Jintan" Jinta]]
* [[Honma Meiko|Honma "Menma" Meiko]]
* [[Anjou Naruko|Anjou "Anaru" Naruko]]
* [[Tsurumi Chiriko|Tsurumi "Tsuruko" Chiriko]]
* [[Matsuyuki Atsumu|Matsuyuki "Yukiatsu" Atsumu]]
* [[Hisakawa Tetsudou|Hisakawa "Poppo" Tetsudou]]

h4. External links

* "Official Site":http://www.anohana.jp/
* "[i]AnoHana[/i] on Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ano_Hi_Mita_Hana_no_Namae_o_Bokutachi_wa_Mada_Shiranai 
* "[i]AnoHana[/i] on pixpedia (Eng)":http://en.dic.pixiv.net/a/We+Still+Don%27t+Know+the+Name+of+the+Flower+We+Saw+That+Day

title: lacey_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Lacey[/b], known as [b]Taro[/b] (タロ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon sv|Pokémon Scarlet and Violet]][/i]'s [i]The Indigo Disk[/i] DLC.

Lacey is a member of Blueberry Academy's Elite Four and specializes in Fairy-type Pokémon.

Lacey is [[Clay (Pokemon)|]]'s daughter, as confirmed by [[Nemona (pokemon)|]] in their [[League Club Room]] interaction.

She has [[arched bangs]] and [[mismatched eyebrows]].

She is often depicted with [[x arms]], referencing some of her scenes in the game. Her catchphrase is "[[it's just not right!]]".

title: sonia_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Sonia[/b] is a character introduced in [[pokemon swsh|Pokemon Sword and Shield]].

Sonia is a new professor researching the legends of Galar and has already published a book with her findings. She’s adventure buddies and childhood friends with [[Leon (pokemon)|]]. Her only known Pokemon is [[Yamper]].

She has [[green eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[orange hair|hair]] with [[heart hair ornament|hearts]] worn in a [[side ponytail|ponytail]]. She [[eyewear on head|wears]] [[sunglasses]], a [[green shirt|green]] [[crop top|cropped]] [[ribbed shirt]] under a [[buttons|buttoned]] [[brown coat|coat]], a [[bracelet]], [[green nails|green]] [[nail polish|nail polish]], [[pants]], [[green footwear|green]] [[high heel boots|heel boots]], and a [[handbag]].

title: piers_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Piers[/b], known as [b]Nezu[/b] (ネズ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon swsh|Pokémon Sword and Shield]][/i].

This Galar Gym Leader who loves Dark-type Pokémon is also a well-known singer and songwriter. Many of his fans were charmed by his melancholic vocal quality.

He has [[pale skin]], [[green eyes]] with [[grey eyeshadow]], and [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[black hair|black]] and [[white hair]] with [[hair over one eye|bangs over one eye]]. He wears a [[shirt]] under a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[white jacket]], a [[belt]], [[mismatched gloves]], [[bike shorts]], and [[boots]].

body:

This Gym Leader from Galar is also a popular model. She grew up playing with Water-type Pokémon thanks to her parents’ influence and is good friends with [[Sonia (pokemon)|]].

She has  [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]], [[aqua eyes|aqua]]/[[blue eyes]] with [[blue eyeshadow|eyeshadow]], and [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[black hair|black]] and [[aqua hair]] with a [[single hair bun|bun]]. She wears [[hoop earrings|earrings]] and an [[earclip]], a [[necklace]], an [[armlet]], a [[belly chain]], [[bike shorts|spats]], a [[dynamax band|wristband]], [[single glove|a]] [[partially fingerless gloves|glove]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[sandals]].

title: gloria_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Gloria[/b], known as [b]Yuuri[/b] (ユウリ) in Japan, is the female player character in [i][[pokemon swsh|Pokémon Sword and Shield]][/i].

Gloria is full of courage and up for any challenge. She is slightly mischievous and enjoys playing outdoors, and she loves curry just as much as she does Pokémon battles [tn](official bio)[/tn]. 

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[bob cut]] [[brown hair]]. She wears a [[green headwear|green]] [[tam o' shanter]], a [[pink dress|pink]] [[collared dress|dress]] under a [[grey cardigan|grey]] [[cable knit]] [[hooded cardigan]] both with [[buttons]], [[green socks|green]] [[plaid socks|plaid]] [[socks]], [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]], and a [[brown bag|brown]] [[backpack]] 

Her [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Casey Shield[/b].

title: guzma_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Guzma[/b] is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]][/i].

He is the strong leader of a group of toughs in Alola called Team Skull. The group's rowdy members obey him, and his kindness has earned their devoted respect [tn](official bio)[/tn]. His signature Pokémon is [[Golisopod]].

He has [[grey eyes]], [[undercut]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[white hair|white]] and [[black hair]], and an [[arm tattoo]]. He wears [[yellow-framed eyewear|yellow-framed]] [[sunglasses]] on his [[eyewear on head|head]], a [[black jacket|black]] [[short sleeves|short sleeve]] [[hooded jacket]], a [[white shirt]], [[black pants]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]].

This [[Team Skull]] Admin controls the rest of the team and is seen as something of a big sister type. She looks after the Grunts and won't forgive anyone who bullies them.

She has [[yellow eyes]] with [[eyeshadow]] and [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[pink hair|pink]] and [[blonde hair|yellow hair]] worn in [[quad tails]]. She wears a [[skull hair ornament]] and [[skull necklace|necklace]], a [[tank top]] which reveals a [[stomach tattoo]] on her [[midriff]], and [[black pants]].

A genius pro [[golf|golfer]] with a stoic personality who competes all over the world, she is also a diligent member of the Elite Four who never neglects Pokémon battles.

title: hapu_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Hapu[/b], known as [b]Hapu'u[/b] (ハプウ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]][/i].

A Island Kahuna who wanders the islands of Alola and has been accepted by its guardian deities, she inherited her title and speaking style from her greatly respected grandfather.

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] worn in [[twintails]]. She wears a [[purple headwear|purple]] [[bonnet]], a [[black belt]] carrying a [[pouch]], [[grey gloves]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]].

title: nanu_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Nanu[/b], known as [b]Kuchinashi[/b] (クチナシ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]][/i].

This Island Kahuna works as a police officer in the Alola region. He appears lazy, but he is truly skilled in Pokémon battles and also deeply compassionate.

He has [[red eyes]] and [[grey hair]]. He wears an [[open jacket|open]] [[short sleeves|short sleeve]] [[black jacket]], a [[red shirt]], a [[z-ring]], [[pants]], and [[flip-flops]].

title: olivia_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Olivia[/b], known as [b]Lychee[/b] (ライチ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]][/i].

This Island Kahuna is trusted like a big sister by her island's residents, thanks to her compassion and strength in battle. The jewelry shop she runs also handles fossils. Her signature Pokemon is [[Lycanroc (midnight)|]].

She is [[dark-skinned female|dark skinned]], has [[black eyes]] with [[bright pupils]], [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] fashioned with [[swept bangs]], [[pink lips]], and [[aqua nails|aqua]] [[nail polish|fingernails]] and [[toenail polish|toenails]]. She wears [[earrings]], numerous [[bangle|bangles]], [[anklet|anklets]], [[thighlet|thighlets]] and [[neck ring|neck rings]], a [[bead necklace]], numerous [[diamond (shape)|diamond-shaped]] [[gem|gems]], a [[sleeveless]] [[pink shirt|pink]] [[crop top]] that reveals [[sideboob]], [[purple shorts|purple]] [[short shorts]], and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[high heels]].

title: sophocles_(pokemon)
body:
Sophocles is a character introduced in [[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]]. He is one of Alola's Trial Captains, specializing in the Electric type. In Sophocles' trial, the player battles a Totem [[Vikavolt]]. In [[pokemon usum|Ultra Sun and Ultra Moon]], they fight a Totem [[Togedemaru]] instead.

Sophocles inherited the position of captain from his cousin, [[Molayne (pokemon)|]], who he shares a close bond with. He is into mechanics, having invented various machines, and is the founder of the Festival Plaza. However, he is quite shy, and afraid of the dark. [spoiler]Sophocles is one of the trainers who can challenge the player for the title of Champion.[/spoiler]

In the [[pokemon (anime)|anime]], Sophocles is also one of [[ash ketchum|Ash]]'s classmates. He is a intelligent but shy boy who became fascinated with space at a young age.

Japanese name: [b]Maamane[/b]

h4. Official Art
* !post #2440941

* [[Vikavolt]]
* [[Alolan Golem]]

title: kiawe_(pokemon)
body:
Kiawe is a character introduced in [[pokemon sm|Pokemon Sun and Moon]]. He is one of Alola's Trial Captains, specializing in the Fire type. In Kiawe's trial, the player battles a Totem [[Salazzle]]. His signature Pokémon is an [[Alolan Marowak]].

Kiawe is a young man who studies the traditional dances of the Alola region, and dreams of becoming a professional fire dancer. The player can meet and battle him in the Battle Tree.

In the [[pokemon (anime)|anime]], he is also one of [[ash ketchum|Ash]]'s classmates. He is a passionate, hot-blooded, and competitive Trainer and a doting big brother to his little sister, [[Mimo (pokemon)|]].

title: kukui_(pokemon)
body:
Prof. Kukui is a character in [[Pokemon]] [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]], and Alola's resident Pokémon expert. He is a passionate man who specializes in Pokémon moves. He is married to [[Burnet (pokemon)|Prof. Burnet]].

He is also known as [b]The Masked Royal[/b] ([b]Royal Mask[/b] in the Japanese version), a famous masked wrestler and star of the Battle Royal Dome.

[spoiler]Kukui later creates Alola's own Pokémon League, and is the last challenge the protagonist overcomes before becoming the League's first champion.[/spoiler]

In the [[pokemon (anime)|anime]], Kukui is a teacher at the Pokémon School that Ash attended. He let him stay at his house.

title: fake_whiskers
body: The term "[[fake whiskers]]" refers to whiskers that are displayed under a camera but are not actually present on the character. These are typically added as a visual effect or accessory in digital or virtual representations, such as in video games or virtual reality environments, to enhance the character's appearance without physically altering the character model.

title: whiskers
body:
Thin hairs on the face that animals use for sensing.

title: augustine_sycamore
body:
[b]Augustine Sycamore[/b], known as [b]Platane[/b] (プラターヌ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon xy|X and Y]][/i].

This friendly Pokémon Professor from Lumiose City in Kalos is researching the mysteries of Mega Evolution. His hobby is sampling food from cafés while walking around town.

He has [[grey eyes]] and [[curly hair|curly]] [[black hair]] including [[facial hair]]. He wears a [[lab coat]], a [[shirt]], a [[wristwatch]], [[black pants]], a [[yellow belt]], [[socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]].

title: lysandre_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Lysandre[/b], known as [b]Fuladari[/b] (フラダリ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon xy|X and Y]][/i].

A well-known researcher and the boss of [[Team Flare]], Lysandre despairs at ugly conflicts in the world. His goal is to create a world where only the chosen ones remain.

He has [[blue eyes]] and [[orange hair]] with a [[beard]]. He wears a [[fur-trimmed jacket]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], a [[ring]], [[pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

title: diantha_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Diantha[/b], known as [b]Carnet[/b] (カルネ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon xy|Pokémon X and Y]][/i].

Diantha is the Kalos Champion and also a famous actress. She's quite friendly and loves striking up conversations with skilled Trainers. She can often be found in cafés [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Gardevoir]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]]. She wears a [[white choker]], a [[necklace]], an [[open coat|open]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[white coat]], a [[white shirt]], [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts]], [[white footwear|white]] [[high heel boots|high-heel]] [[ankle boots]], and [[holding bag|carries]] a [[pink bag|pink]] [[purse]].

title: mallow_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Mallow[/b], known as [b]Mao[/b] (マオ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]][/i].

Mallow is a captain on Akala Island in Alola and works at a restaurant where she hones her skills as a chef. Her cooking is unique but popular among some [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Tsareena]]. 

She has [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]], [[green eyes]], and [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and in [[twintails]]. She wears a [[green headband|headband]] with a [[pink flower|flower]], a [[pink shirt|shirt]] under [[grey overalls|grey]] [[overall shorts|overalls]], and [[green footwear|green]] [[two-tone footwear|and]] [[white footwear|white]] [[shoes]] with [[green ribbon|green]] [[footwear ribbon|ribbons]].

title: iris_(pokemon)
body:
A [[Pokemon]] character.

In the [[pokemon (game)|games]], Iris is a young, nature-loving girl and Unova's eighth Gym Leader in [[Pokemon BW|Pokémon White]]. Her specialty is Dragon-types, and she is [[Drayden (pokemon)|]]'s apprentice. Her main Pokémon is [[Haxorus]]. She returns in [[pokemon bw2|Pokémon Black and White 2]] as the new Champion of the Unova region.

In the [[pokemon_(anime)|anime]], she is also one of [[Ash Ketchum|Ash]]'s former companions. She has a [[Axew]] that lives in her hair. Like [[Misty (pokemon)|]], Iris is frequently critical of Ash's actions as a trainer, calling him childish. She aims to be a master of Dragon-type Pokémon, and must evolve her [[Axew]] into it's final stage, [[Haxorus]] to be considered one. She is also known for being the first naturally dark-skinned main character in the Pokémon series. She returns in [[pokemon journeys|Pokémon Journeys]] in her capacity as Champion of Unova, and battles Ash as he climbs the ranks of the World Coronation Series. [spoiler]Eventually, she joins Ash in the Masters Eight.[/spoilers]

h4. Official Art
* !post #5549883: [[pokemon bw|BW]]
* !post #5549892: [[pokemon bw2|BW2]]

title: n_(pokemon)
body:
Lead antagonist of [[pokemon_bw|Pokemon Black and White]], and supporting character in [[pokemon_bw2|Pokemon Black 2 and White 2]].

He is the "King" of [[Team Plasma]]. He regularly challenges the player character, [[Hilbert (pokemon)|]] or [[Hilda (pokemon)|]], in order to confirm his ideas of justice. He calls Pokémon "friends", but he wants to split humans and Pokémon and divide them to create a black and white world, as he wanted to set Pokémon free from people (who he viewed to be their oppressor), and looks for the power to bring his idea to reality. 

He returns in the sequel games to help thwart the schemes of his father, [[Ghetsis (pokemon)|]], who has formed his own Team Plasma with the intent of taking over Unova by force.

Full Name: [b]Natural Harmonia Gropius[/b]

h4. Official Art
* !post #6754933: [[pokemon bw|BW]]
* !post #6754909: [[pokemon bw2|BW2]]

h4.See also

* [[N's room]]

title: bianca_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Bianca[/b], known as [b]Bel[/b] (ベル) in Japan, is a character introduced in [[pokemon bw|Pokemon Black and White]].

Bianca is a Trainer who once traveled across the Unova region. She loves Pokémon and currently works as an assistant to [[aurea juniper|Professor Juniper]] to learn more about them [tn](official bio)[/tn].

She has [[green eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]]. She initially wears a [[green headwear|green]] [[beret|hat]], a [[short sleeves|short-sleeve]] [[white dress|dress]], an [[orange vest]] and [[orange pantyhose|pantyhose]], [[yellow footwear|yellow]] [[flats]], and carries a [[green bag|green]] [[shoulder bag|bag]] with the [[strap between breasts|strap between her breasts]].

In [[Pokemon BW2]] she dons a new outfit including a hat [[hat bow|with]] a [[white bow]], [[red-framed eyewear|red]] [[semi-rimless eyewear|semi-rimless]] [[glasses]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[v-neck]] shirt, an [[open jacket|open]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[orange jacket|orange]] [[hooded jacket|jacket]], [[green pants|green]] [[capri pants]], and [[orange footwear|orange]] [[ankle boots]].

Voiced by [[Taketatsu Ayana]].

title: lyra_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Lyra[/b], known as [b]Kotone[/b] (コトネ) in Japan, is the female player character in [i][[pokemon hgss|Pokémon HeartGold and SoulSilver]][/i].

This highly curious, active young Trainer cherishes the bonds she has with her Pokémon. She is always doting on them.

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] worn in [[twintails]]. title: hogwarts_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] design from the [[Harry Potter (series)|]] series, worn by students at the Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

The uniform typically consists of a [[grey sweater]] or [[cardigan]] over a white [[dress shirt]] and black [[pants]] or a [[black skirt]]. A black [[hooded cloak]] goes over their clothes. Both the inner lining of the cloak and the [[necktie]] and various accessories will be in the student's house color.

Back in the late 19th century, when [[Hogwarts Legacy]] happens, the uniform had [[plaid pants]] for the boys and [[long skirt|long]] [[plaid skirt]]s for the girls.

h4. House colors
* [[Gryffindor]]: red and gold
* [[Ravenclaw]]: blue and grey
* [[Hufflepuff]]: yellow and black
* [[Slytherin]]: green and silver

h4.See also

* [[List of Uniforms]]

title: barry_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Barry[/b], known as [b]Jun[/b] (ジュン) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon dppt|Diamond and Pearl]][/i].

An incredibly impetuous, high-spirited young man who runs straight for what he wants without any hesitation, he has an earnest passion for Pokémon [tn](official bio)[/tn].

He has [[orange eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]]. He wears a [[green scarf|scarf]], a [[short sleeves|short-sleeve]] [[striped jacket|jacket]], a [[poketch|Pokétch]], [[grey pants|pants]], [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]], and a [[brown bag|brown]] [[shoulder bag|bag]]. In [[pokemon platinum|Platinum]], his [[winter clothes|winter]] jacket has [[long sleeves]].

His [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Pearl[/b].

title: shinkansen
body:
The Shinkansen (Japanese: 新幹線, lit. 'new main line'), colloquially known in English as the bullet train, is a network of [[high-speed train|high-speed railway]] lines in Japan. It is operated by five [[Japan Railways]] Group companies. The popular English name [i]bullet train[/i] is a literal translation of the Japanese term [i]dangan ressha[/i] (弾丸列車), a nickname given to the project while it was initially discussed in the 1930s. The name stuck because of the original 0 Series Shinkansen's resemblance to a bullet and its high speed. (from Wikipedia)

!asset #23220925

title: shinkansen_500_series
body:
The 500 series (500系, Go-hykau-kei) is a [[Shinkansen]] [[high-speed train]] type operated by [[West Japan Railway Company]] ([[West Japan Railway Company|JR-West]]) in Japan on the Tōkaidō Shinkansen line from 1997 until 2010, and the San'yō Shinkansen line since 1997 and 2008. They were designed to be capable of 320 km/h (199 mph) but operated at 300 km/h (186 mph), until they were retired from the primary Nozomi service in 2010.

Since 7 November 2015, set V2 runs in a special "500 Type Eva" livery as part of the "Shinkansen:Evangelion Project" tie-up project to mark the 40th anniversary of the Sanyo Shinkansen and the 20th anniversary of [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]]. Initially planned to operate until March 2017, this livery was extended until 13 May 2018. From 24 February until 7 May 2018, the 500 series car preserved at the Kyoto Railway Museum was exhibited in the "500 Type Eva" livery.

In March 2018, JR West announced the launch of a special "[[Hello Kitty]]" themed 500 series train on Sanyo Shinkansen Kodama services.

H4. Examples 
* !asset #23691266: [[shinkansen_500_series|JR West Shinkansen 500 Series]]
* !asset #23691275: W Set's T-style Current Collector/[[Pantograph]]
* !asset #23707591: 500 Series [[Neon Genesis Evangelion|Type EVA]]
* !asset #23707682: [[Hello Kitty]] [[Shinkansen]].

title: ajinomoto
body:
Japanese multinational food and chemical corporation, most well-known internationally for its [[monosodium glutamate]] (MSG) product, from which the company derives its name, Aji-No-Moto (literally "essence of taste").  Alongside MSG and other condiments/seasonings, the company also produces processed foods such as instant noodles (ala [[instant ramen]] and pasta) and instant soups, frozen foods, coffees, cooking oils, TV dinners, sweeteners, amino acids and pharmaceuticals, among other things. In particular it is the world's largest producer of aspartame, with a 40% global market share.

They also produce [[Knorr (brand)|]]-branded products in Japan under license.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ajinomoto

title: brawly_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Brawly[/b], known as [b]Touki[/b] (トウキ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rse|Ruby and Sapphire]][/i].

This Gym Leader is skilled with Fighting-type Pokémon and also trains his body to surf. He moved from Kanto to Hoenn for the waves. His signature Pokémon is [[Hariyama]].

In his original appearance, he has [[blue eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[spiked hair|spiked]] [[blue hair]]. He wears a [[short sleeves|short-sleeve]] [[orange shirt]] over a [[black undershirt|black]] [[undershirt]], [[baggy pants|baggy]] [[blue pants|blue]] [[capri pants]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[two-tone footwear|and]] [[orange footwear|orange]] [[shoes]].

In [[Pokemon ORAS]] he undergoes a redesign, including [[dark-skinned male|darker skin]] and [[long hair|longer hair]].  He wears [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[orange-tinted eyewear|orange-tinted]] [[sunglasses]] [[eyewear on head|on his head]], a [[skin tight]] [[black shirt]], and [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]].

title: may_(pokemon)
body:
[b]May[/b], known as [b]Haruka[/b] (ハルカ) in Japan, is the female player character in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rse|Ruby, Sapphire,]] and [[Pokemon Emerald|Emerald]][/i].

May is a cheerful girl and the daughter of Professor Birch from the Hoenn region. She's great at taking care of others and loves cute Pokémon and conducting fieldwork [tn](official bio)[/tn].

In her [[pokemon oras|ORAS]] outfit, she has [[grey eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[brown hair]]. She wears an [[orange hairband|orange]] [[bow hairband|hairband]], a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[orange shirt|shirt]], a [[bracelet]], [[bike shorts]] [[bike shorts under shorts|under]] [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts|shorts]], [[yellow footwear|yellow]] [[shoes]], and a [[green bag|green]] [[fanny pack|belt bag]].

Her [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Sapphire[/b] who has [[fangs]].

title: karen_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Karen[/b], known as [b]Karin[/b] (カリン) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon gsc|Gold and Silver]][/i].

Beneath her calm, cerebral exterior, a passion for Pokémon lurks in this Elite Four member's heart. She likes wild and tough Dark-type Pokémon.

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[grey hair]].

title: jasmine_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Jasmine[/b], known as [b]Mikan[/b] (ミカン) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon gsc|Gold and Silver]][/i].

This Gym Leader is known to have a heart that cares for Pokémon. While she appears calm and gentle, she can get quite fired up when talking about Steel-type Pokémon. Her signature Pokémon is [[Steelix]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[light brown hair]]. She wears [[hair bobbles]], a [[sundress]], and [[sandals]].

title: morty_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Morty[/b], known as [b]Matsuba[/b] (マツバ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon gsc|Gold and Silver]][/i].

This Ghost-type Gym Leader has secretly trained at the Ecruteak City Gym his entire life. As a result, he can now see what others cannot. His signature Pokémon is [[Gengar]].

He has [[blonde hair]]. He wears a [[headband]] and [[pants]].

title: whitney_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Whitney[/b], known as [b]Akane[/b] (アカネ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon gsc|Gold and Silver]][/i].

A lively, talkative, trend-following Gym Leader who's proud of her cute Pokémon, she cries in disappointment when she loses a battle. Her signature Pokémon is [[Miltank]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]] worn in [[twintails]] with [[hairclip|hairclips]]. She wears a  [[white jacket|white]] [[short sleeves|short sleeve]] jacket, [[short shorts]], [[socks]], and [[shoes]].

title: falkner_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Falkner[/b], known as [b]Hayato[/b] (ハヤト) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon gsc|Gold and Silver]][/i].

This Flying-type Pokémon user and Johto Gym Leader has a serious demeanor and can be a bit hardheaded. He aims to become a great Trainer like his father [tn](official bio)[/tn]. His signature Pokémon is [[Pidgeot]].

He has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] which [[hair over one eye|covers one eye]]. In his [[pokemon hgss|HGSS]] outfit, he wears a [[blue kimono|kimono]] with a [[sash]] under an [[open jacket|open]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeve]] [[blue jacket|blue]] [[haori]], [[black wristband|black]] [[wristband|wristbands]], [[hakama pants|hakama shorts]], [[white legwear|white]] [[kneehighs]], and [[shoes]].

title: agatha_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Agatha[/b], known as [b]Kikuko[/b] (キクコ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rgby|Red and Green]][/i].

A strong—willed veteran with a penchant for battling, this member of the Elite Four tries to wear opponents down. She seems to have some history with Professor Oak [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Gengar]].

In her [[pokemon frlg|FRLG]] outfit, she has [[black eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[flipped hair|flipped]] [[blonde hair]] with [[parted bangs]]. She wears a [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[purple dress|dress]] with a [[pearl (gemstone)|pearl]], a [[white apron|white]] [[waist apron|apron]], [[brown pantyhose]], [[purple footwear|purple]] [[shoes]], and a [[cane]].

title: bruno_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Bruno[/b], known as [b]Siba[/b] (シバ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rgby|Red and Green]][/i].

A member of the Elite Four who believes that people and Pokémon can become stronger though rigorous—even extreme—training, he shouts "Hoo Hah!" to get fired up [tn](official bio)[/tn]. His signature Pokémon is [[Machamp]].

He is [[muscular male|muscular]], has [[black eyes]], and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied in a [[ponytail]] with [[long sideburns]]. He is [[topless male|shirtless]] and wears [[bracelet]]s, a [[black belt|black cloth]] [[belt]], [[torn pants|torn]] [[white pants]], [[anklet]]s, and is [[barefoot]].

title: lorelei_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Lorelei[/b], known as [b]Kanna[/b] (カンナ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rgby|Red and Green]][/i].

This cool beauty who uses Ice-type Pokémon is one of the Elite Four. She likes cute things and has many plushies at home.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair]] worn in a [[ponytail]]. She wears [[glasses]], a [[pencil skirt]], and [[high heels]].

title: blaine_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Blaine[/b], known as [b]Katsura[/b] (カツラ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rgby|Red and Green]][/i].

This old man with a passion for trivia is known as the hotheaded quiz master. He's a Fire-type Gym Leader with a veteran Trainer's skill and a researcher's knowledge [tn](official bio)[/tn]. His signature Pokémon is [[Arcanine]].

In his [[pokemon frlg|FRLG]] outfit, he is [[old man|old]], [[bald]], and has a [[white hair|white]] [[mustache]]. He wears [[round eyewear|round]] [[sunglasses]], a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[grey shirt|shirt]], an [[orange necktie|orange]] [[poke ball print|print]] necktie, a [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[lab coat]], [[purple pants|pants]] with a [[belt buckle|buckled]] [[black belt|belt]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]].

title: surge_(pokemon)
body:
マチス [b]Matis[/b] (Japanese), [b]Lt. Surge[/b] (English)

Electric-type Gym Leader of Vermilion City, Kanto in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] media. Signature Pokémon: [[Raichu]], [[Electabuzz]]/[[Electivire]].

Former officer in the [[united states|United States]] Army.

h4. Variations

* {{surge_(pokemon) pokemon_rgby}}
** His original appearance, as a Gym Leader, in [i][[pokemon_rgby|RGBY]][/i].
* {{surge_(pokemon) pokemon_gsc}}
** He appears in [i][[pokemon_gsc|GSC]][/i].
* {{surge_(pokemon) pokemon_frlg}}
** He appears in [i][[pokemon_frlg|FRLG]][/i].
* {{surge_(pokemon) pokemon_hgss}}
** He appears in [i][[pokemon_hgss|HGSS]][/i].
* {{surge_(pokemon) pokemon_adventures}}
** In the [i]RGB chapter[/i] of [i][[pokemon adventures|Pokémon Adventures]][/i], he is a high-ranking member of [[Team Rocket]], along with the other Gym Leaders [[sabrina (pokemon)|Natsume/Sabrina]] and [[koga (pokemon)|Kyou/Koga]].
* {{surge_(pokemon) pokemon_(anime)}}
** He battled against [[Ash Ketchum|Ash]] in the [[pokemon (anime)|anime]].

h4. Official Art
* !post #3218765: [[Pokemon lgpe|LGPE]]

h4. Surge's Pokémon

* [[Pikachu]]
* [[Raichu]]

h6. Surge's Pokémon ([i]anime[/i] and [i]Yellow[/i])

* [[Raichu]]

h6. Surge's Pokémon ([i]GSC/HGSS[/i])

* [[Raichu]]

* [[Magneton]]
* [[Voltorb]]
* [[Electrode (pokemon)|]]
* [[Raichu]]

* [[Raikou]]
* [[Gyarados]]

title: giovanni_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Giovanni[/b], known as [b]Sakaki[/b] (サカキ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rgby|Red and Green]][/i], serving as the series' recurring and main antagonist.

This leader of the expansive Team Rainbow Rocket enterprise, which aims to use Pokémon to rule the world, believes Pokémon are no more than tools [tn](official bio)[/tn]. His signature Pokémon is [[Rhyperior]].

He has [[black eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]]. He wears a [[grey shirt|grey]] [[turtleneck]] shirt under a [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] [[v-neck]] [[black jacket]] which has the Team Rocket [[logo]] emblazoned on the front, [[black pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

title: blue_oak
body:
[b]Blue[/b], known as [b]Green[/b] (グリーン) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rgby|Red and Green]][/i].

This highly skilled, powerhouse Trainer prominent in Kanto is the grandson of the famous Professor Oak. [[Red (pokemon)|]] is both his lifelong rival and his best friend [tn](official bio)[/tn].

In his [[pokemon hgss|HGSS]] outfit, he has [[brown eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[spiked hair|spiky]] [[orange hair]]. He wears a [[white shirt]] under a [[grey jacket|grey]] [[leather jacket]] with two [[breast pocket|breast pockets]], a [[black belt]] with a metal [[belt buckle|buckle]], [[brown pants]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[shoes]]

His [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is also named [b]Blue[/b] (or Green in Japan).

title: trixie_(blade_runner)
body:
Fictional female character from the [[Blade Runner: Black Out 2022]] science fiction [[cyberpunk]] anime short film from 2017.

[b]Trixie[/b] is [spoiler]a female Nexus-8 [[replicant]] designed for pleasure. She has a human boyfriend called Ren.[/spoiler]

title: red_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Red[/b] is the male player character in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon rgby|Red and Green]][/i].

The silent type, this legendary, awesome Pokémon Trainer hardly talks at all. His best friend, [[Blue Oak|Blue]], is also his rival [tn](official bio)[/tn].

In his [[pokemon frlg|classic]] outfit, he has [[brown eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[spiked hair|spiky]] [[brown hair]]. He wears a [[red headwear|red]] [[baseball cap|cap]], a [[t-shirt]] under a [[red jacket|red]] [[sleeveless jacket]], [[black wristband|wristbands]], [[baggy pants|baggy]] [[blue pants|pants]], [[shoes]], a [[yellow bag|yellow]] [[backpack]], and a [[vs seeker]].

His [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is also named [b]Red[/b].

title: lana_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Lana[/b], known as [b]Suiren[/b] (スイレン) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]][/i].

Lana is an avid fisher and one of the captains of Akala Island. She loves her family and is constantly helping the family business or babysitting her twin sisters [tn](official bio)[/tn]. Her signature Pokémon is [[Araquanid]].

She has [[blue eyes]] with [[bright pupils|bright]] [[white pupils|pupils]] and [[no sclera]], [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]], and [[freckles]]. She wears a [[yellow hairband|hairband]], a [[one-piece swimsuit|swimsuit]] [[swimsuit under clothes|under]] a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt|shirt]] with a [[blue sailor collar|blue collar]], [[blue pants|blue]] [[wave print]] [[capri pants|pants]], and [[flip-flops]].

title: bea_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Bea[/b], known as [b]Saitou[/b] (サイトウ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon swsh|Sword and Shield]][/i].

This Gym Leader is a karate prodigy from Galar who is highly disciplined and trains daily. She also loves sweets, but she likes to keep that a secret [tn](official bio)[/tn].

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] with [[hair between eyes|long bangs]]. She wears a [[black hairband|black]] [[bow hairband|hairband]], a [[black bodysuit|bodysuit]] [[bodysuit under clothes|under]] a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeve]] [[print shirt|shirt]] and [[side slit shorts|side slit]] [[print shorts|shorts]], a [[dynamax band|wristband]], [[single glove|a]] [[partially fingerless gloves|glove]], [[knee pads]], and is [[barefoot]].

body:

title: frankenstein's_monster
body:
A monster created by Dr. [[Victor Frankenstein]] by unspecified means.

Most modern depictions of Frankenstein's monster are based on the "1931 adaptation":https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0021884/, in which the monster was stitched together from parts of corpses and animated by electricity from a lightning storm. Monsters based on this film tend to have angular features, prominent [[stitches]], and [[bolt (hardware)|bolts]] drilled into the head or neck. Later depictions from the era of color film gave the monster [[grey_skin|grey]] or [[green skin]].

h4. See also

* [[Frankenstein]]
* [[golem]]
* [[monster]]
* [[undead]]
* [[Tag Group:Legendary Creatures]]
other_names: フランケンシュタインの怪物

body:
Free and open-source file archiver, developed by Igor Pavlov.

It has its own file format called 7z, but it can read other formats.

title: winrar
body:
WinRAR is a trialware file archiver utility, used to create RAR and ZIP files.

It's also known for continuing to work even after the "40-day trial" period.

"Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WinRAR]

title: amelie_planchard
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Katayoku no Majo-tachi]]

A Sergeant from Gallia serving in the [[Isle of Wight Detachment Group]]. A very shy and crybaby girl, known for her crush on [[Perrine H. Clostermann]], and for being [[Wilma Bishop]]'s girltoy.

Her weapon is a Bren Light Machine gun Mk 1. Her familiar is a European rabbit, and she's based on Henri Planchard.
other_names: アメリー・プランシャール

title: luciana_mazzei
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Kurenai no Majo-tachi]].

A Pilot Officer from Romagna serving in the [[504th Joint Fighter Wing]], Ardor Witches. Member of the Pantaloni Rossi trio with [[Fernandia Malvezzi]] and [[Martina Crespi]].
Her familiar is a greyhound, her weapons are the anti-tank rifles Solothurn S-18/1000 and Boys, and she's based on Pietro Mazzei.
other_names: ルチアナ・マッツェイ

title: javanese_text
body:
Posts that contain text written in Javanese, either in Latin or its own Javanese script.

The Javanese language is an Austronesian language. It is spoken mostly on [[Java]], in [[Indonesia]].
Its closest relatives include [[sundanese_text|Sundanese]], [[madurese_text|Madurese]] and [[balinese_text|Balinese]] with [[malay_text|Malay]] and, therefore, [[indonesian_text|Indonesian]] being its distant relatives.

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Text]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Javanese language":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Javanese_language
* "Wikipedia: Javanese script":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Javanese_script

title: tiny_green_mall_wizard
body:
[b]Tiny Green Mall Wizard[/b], also known as the Wizard Gnome, is a character created by TikToker "crawly_possessed" with which he dresses in a fake white beard, green robes and a white cone-shaped hat while crawling through stores in a mall. The TikToker previously went viral for the Crawling In Public trend in which he invited his followers to come crawl through a mall in Warsaw, Poland with him. The creator posted his first video as the Tiny Green Mall Wizard in late June 2024.

Since then Crawly has engaged in racism, hate speech, staged vandalism, real vandalism and overall aggressive behavior which coupled with his earlier harassment of mall workers earned him rightful bans on both TikTok and Kick. On November 29th 2024 he was apprehended by Polish Border Guard to begin a deportation procedure.

title: korok_seed
body: Items in [[the legend of zelda: breath of the wild|Breath of the Wild]] and [[the legend of zelda: tears of the kingdom|Tears of the Kingdom]]. You get one every time you find one of the 900 (BotW)/1000 (TotK) hidden [[Korok]]s throughout the world, and can be given to [[Hestu]] to expand your inventory space.

title: couple
body:
Two persons who are shown to be [b]mutually[/b] attracted to each other. That is to say, don't add this tag if one of the group is uncertain or shying away.

h4. Notes

* Do not add this tag based on canonicity. A picture with a canon couple who are not doing anything couple-like should not have this tag.
* Do not use this tag for all pictures with consensual sex/[[happy sex]]. There must be indication that the two involved are in love or have affection for one another.
* Both persons must be present in the picture. A hand or a penis is not a person.
* Please add [[hetero]], [[yaoi]], [[yuri]], [[other with female]], [[other with male]], [[other with other]], [[cuntboy]] or [[futanari]] to describe the type of couple.

h4. Romantic activities

* [[confession]]
* [[dating]]
* [[flirting]]
* [[marriage proposal]]
* [[wedding]]

h4. Romantic Relationships

* [[harem]]
* [[otaple]]
* [[husband and wife]]
* [[husband and husband]]
* [[wife and wife]]

h4. See Also
* [[afterglow]]
* [[cheating (relationship)]]
* [[lovestruck]]
* [[pov cheek warming (meme)]]

title: yuri
body:
Any romantic or sexual interaction between female characters, mutual or not. If it's mutual, consider adding the [[couple]] tag.

For Danbooru purposes, [[futanari]] is not yuri. Use [[futa with female]] or [[futa with futa]] instead.

For Danbooru purposes, [[bisexual female]] activity is also not yuri. Use [[bisexual female]] instead.

h4. Related tags

title: yaoi
body:
Any romantic and/or sexual depiction between males, doesn't matter if it's mutual or one-sided.

If it's mutual, consider adding the [[couple]] tag.

h6. Note

* While the concept of "yaoi" and "boy's love" are distinct in Japan (NSFW and SFW respectively), in the West, "yaoi" is the common term utilized, and used to refer to both - as a result, don't use shounen ai / boy's love / boy love as tags; use {{yaoi is:sfw}} or {{yaoi rating:q}} to search for BL instead, and {{yaoi rating:e}} for proper yaoi.
* While the most common concept of "boy's love" involves men with [[bishounen]] features in Japan (and in turn "yaoi" in the West), on Danbooru, as mentioned, this tag applies to any depiction of male homosexuality, including [[bara]] and [[otoko no ko]].
* Use the [[bisexual male]] tag where appropriate [b]instead[/b] of the yaoi tag.
* This tag doesn't necessarily apply to objects that characters are holding, like the cover of a manga that someone is holding. Use [[yaoi (object)]] in combination with [[fujoshi]], [[fudanshi]], and/or [[otaku]] instead. 

h4. Related tags

* [[Bishounen]] - beautiful younger males
* [[Bara]] - male homosexual works with masculine features
* [[Otoko no ko]] - male homosexual works with feminine features
* [[Implied yaoi]]
* [[Male focus]]
* [[Male futanari]]
* [[Cuntboy]]
** [[Cuntboy with male]]
* [[Newhalf with male]]
* [[Muscular uke]]
* [[Fujoshi]]
* [[Fudanshi]] 

h4. Related pools
* Almost Yaoi pool #6546
* Mature Gay Couple pool #21194

h4. See also

* [[Yuri]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Yaoi":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yaoi

title: tongue_twister
body:
A phrase designed to be difficult to articulate properly, and can be used as a type of spoken (or [[singing|sung]]) word game. Some tongue twisters produce results that are humorous (or humorously vulgar) when they are mispronounced, while others simply rely on the confusion and mistakes of the speaker for their amusement value.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Tongue twister":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tongue_twister

title: goomboss
body:
Boss character introduced in [i][[Paper Mario 64]][/i], and later incorporated into [i][[Super Mario 64 DS]][/i] and [i][[Mario Kart DS]][/i]. 

Formerly known as the [b]Goomba King[/i], he is a large [[Goomba]] with a [[crown]], crazy [[ringed eyes]] and red-and-white [[striped pants]]. He has large, distinctive singular white [[facial hair]] on each side of his face.

title: madame_clairvoya
body:
A portrait ghost to be captured in [i][[Luigi's Mansion]][/i]. 

Known as the [b]Freaky-Fortune Teller[/b], she can tell the future by connecting with the spirit world and peering into her crystal ball. If [[Luigi]] brings her [[Mario]]'s lost items she will slowly uncover his whereabouts and the secrets of the mansion.

Her notable trademarks are having [[long_hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[blue skin]], and [[glowing_eyes|glowing]] [[yellow eyes]] that [[solid_eyes|lack pupils]]. She wears a [[red dress]], a [[gold necklace]] and big [[hoop_earrings|earrings]]. Both her head and her [[mouth_veil|mouth]] are covered in [[purple veil]]s.

She is the only Portrait Ghost who is not an enemy and volunteers to be captured, as she apparently prefers the "peace" of being in the painting.

title: kipfel_(vrchat)
body:
[[kipfel_(vrchat)|Kipfel]] is an original 3D character by [[Mochiyama Kingyo]] for [[VRChat]].

She features [[animal ears]] and a [[tail]], complemented by her [[very long hair|very long]] [[grey hair]] and [[green eyes]]. On her head, she wears a [[black hat|black]] [[beanie]] designed to resemble a [[cat hat]], adorned with a [[fish bone]] decoration. She is also seen with a [[black necktie]].

For her upper body, she dons a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[green shirt]], topped with a [[green sweater]] [[sweater vest|vest]]. Her lower attire consists of a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt]]. There is a [[bandaid]] on her left knee, and [[black footwear|black]] [[lace-up boots]] on her feet.

title: rose_quartz_universe
body:
Former leader of the Crystal Gems, a resistance force to prevent her Homeworld from destroying the Earth. Mother of [[Steven Quartz Universe]]. Died when she gave up her physical form to give birth to her son.

[spoiler]Accused of shattering [[Pink Diamond (steven universe)|]], one of the four leaders of Homeworld.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]Was secretly Pink Diamond all along, and fabricated her Rose Quartz persona[/spoiler]

title: tilted_halo
body: Unlike a "traditional halo":[/wiki_pages/traditional_halo] that hovers directly above the crown of the head, a tilted halo might lean to the left or right, making it appear asymmetrical when viewed from the front.

title: kaenbyou_rin
body:
The "Traffic Accident of Hell". Stage 4 mid-boss, Stage 5 mid-boss and boss and Stage 6 mid-boss of [[Touhou]]'s [i][[Subterranean Animism]][/i]. Also known as "Orin" (お燐) to differentiate her from the earlier, concept-only character [[Satsuki Rin]].

A [i]kasha[/i] (monster [[cat girl|cat]]) responsible for transporting corpses on her [[wheelbarrow]] to the Hell of Blazing Fires to regulate its heat. Having learned of [[Reiuji Utsuho]]'s new power and her naive ambition to conquer the surface world, and fearing punishment from their master [[Komeiji Satori]], Rin sent evil spirits above the ground to warn any able fighter to face this threat. Apparent master of the so-called "[[zombie fairy (touhou)|Zombie Fairies]]". Occasionally depicted as a necrophiliac. She appears to have befriended [[Chen]] in [[Foul Detective Satori]], and passed her talent for finding and retrieving dead bodies to her.

h4. Appearance
* !post #6586882

She has both [[cat ears|cat]] [[extra ears|and]] [[pointy ears|human-ish ears]], [[red hair]] in [[twin braids]] tied with [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]]s, [[blunt bangs|blunted bangs]], and [[two tails|two]] [[cat tail]]s. Her outfit is a [[green dress|green]] or [[black dress]] with either [[puffy short sleeves]] or [[juliet sleeves]] but almost [[frilled dress|always]] [[frilled sleeves|frilled]], a [[black ribbon|black]] [[leg ribbon]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]]. Often accompanied by her [[floating skull|floating]] and [[flaming skull]]s.

Her [[kaenbyou rin (cat)|cat form]] is as a [[black cat]] with [[two tails]], occasionally [[flame-tipped tail|flame-tipped]].
h4. See also

* "Nyan Clan of Gensokyo":/pools/17046

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Rin Kaenbyou":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Rin_Kaenbyou

title: mira-cra_park!
body:
One of three units formed within the [[link! like! love live!|Hasu no Sora Jogakuin School Idol Club]], passed down through tradition in the club's history.
Their songs tend to be more hyper and wacky.

Its current members are [[Osawa Rurino]], [[Fujishima Megumi]], and [[Anyoji Hime]].

This tag may be used for any iteration of the group.

[table]
  [thead]
    [tr]
      [th]Year[/th]
      [th colspan="2"]Members[/th]
    [/tr]
  [/thead]
  [tbody]
    [tr]
      [td]103rd[/td]
      [td colspan="2"][[Osawa Rurino]], [[Fujishima Megumi]][/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
      [td]104th[/td]
      [td colspan="2"][[Osawa Rurino]], [[Fujishima Megumi]], [[Anyoji Hime]][/td]
    [/tr]

title: petey_piranha
body:
A boss character introduced in [i][[Super Mario Sunshine]][/i].

A colossal [[Piranha Plant]] that isn't rooted to the ground but is able to walk freely, making it much more similar to that of a [[Ptooie]] or [[Trottin' Piranha Plant]]. 

While he has [[sharp teeth]] and [[no eyes]] like his lesser Piranha Plant brethren, unlike them he is clothed with [[polka_dot|polka-dotted]] pants.

title: captain_syrup
body:
[[Wario Land]] character and the main antagonist of [i][[Wario Land: Super Mario Land 3]][/i] and [i][[Wario Land II]][/i]. 

Leader of the Black Sugar Gang pirates. She steals treasure from all around the world and hordes her ill-begotten gains in Syrup Castle, located on Kitchen Island.

In her appearances in [i]Wario Land: Super Mario Land 3[/i] and [i]Wario Land II[/i], she's seen wearing a cyan one-piece outfit with yellow sashes throughout. In her reappearance in [i][[Wario Land: Shake It!]][/i], she's been given a purple top and bandana, black pants and a red skull belt with it.

title: instant_loss
body:
Images themed on the "almost comically instant loss" situations. Often used with [[mating press]] and [[chinpo ni wa katenakatta yo]]. Though not all instant loss post involves sexual engagements.

This tag does not necessarily have to follow the [[2koma]] format, and can apply to two separately uploaded posts, so long as they depict a series of sequential events.

"Pixiv Encyclopedia":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E5%8D%B3%E5%A0%95%E3%81%A12%E3%82%B3%E3%83%9E%E3%82%B7%E3%83%AA%E3%83%BC%E3%82%BA said that it started as a personal webcomic series by a certain artist. After that, however, the original webcomics were deleted for some reason. The series name is now used as a general tag on pixiv.

[b]Note:[/b] Just because a post depicts an SFW scene followed by an NSFW scene, it doesn't necessarily mean it's an "instant loss" situation.

title: inugami_korone_(sonikoro)
body:
The [[official alternate costume|official costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Inugami Korone]] that debuted as part of a collaboration with [[SEGA]], the year-long [i]SoniKoro 2022[/i] collab.

Becoming an official ambassador of [[Sonic (series)|]], Korone's eyes turned [[green eyes|green]] and her hair turned [[blue hair|blue]] to match with her [[Sonic the Hedgehog]] [[hoodie]]. She wears a [[black shirt]] with Sega's logo on it and with [[no pants]]. She also carries a [[Knuckles the Echidna]] plushie on her right arm.

For the [i]SoniKoro 2024[/i] collab, a merch-only variant of this costume appeared, first revealed as part of Japanese pre-order bonuses for [[Sonic X Shadow Generations]], rendering her hoodie in the style of [[Shadow the Hedgehog]], while her eyes have turned [[red eyes|red]] and her hair [[black hair|black]] (referred to as Shadow Korone, or ShadKoro). Her [[black hoodie]] is accentuated with a [[fur-trimmed collar]] to match Shadow's fur tuff on his chest, and she's also seen wearing [[black shorts]], [[uneven legwear|uneven]] [[black thighhighs]], and Shadow's [[white footwear|white]] and [[red footwear|red]] hover [[shoes]]. The design would later be used for a collab cafe event.

h4. Appearance

* !post #5458319: Profile

The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of the [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|Vtuber]] [[Marikyuunn (vtuber)|]]. Designed by [[Kirame Kirai]].

In this costume, she wears a [[pink dress|pink]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[frilled dress]], [[pink gloves]] and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[boots]].
For her [[official alternate hairstyle|hairstyle]] in this costume, her [[long hair|long]] [[orange hair]] is tied into a [[one side up]] held together with [[heart hair ornament|heart ornaments]].

She wears a [[single leg pantyhose|single]] [[fishnet legwear|fishnet]] on her right leg and a [[purple ribbon]] on her left.

In this look, she wears her hair in [[braid|braided]] [[two side up]].

body:

It consists of a [[frilled kimono]] with a [[black kimono|black]] to [[aqua kimono|aqua]] [[gradient_kimono|gradient]] and a [[starry sky print|starry sky]] [[print kimono|print]] and a [[side slit]], worn [[off shoulder]] revealing a [[sarashi]] underneath, a [[white scarf|white]] [[fur scarf]] and  [[black footwear|black]] [[okobo]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official haistyle]] with this outfit is [[absurdly long hair]] with [[hair intakes]], [[parted bangs]] and long [[side braids]], decorated with [[head chain]]s and [[hair flower|flower]] [[kanzashi]].

title: pillowdear_(old_design)
body:
The original costume of the [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] [[PillowDear]], used in her early streams before debuting her Live2D model. It was designed and drawn by Pillow herself.

This original costume featured a [[cable knit]], [[sleeveless]] [[sweater]] similar to her [[pillowdear (1st costume)|current Live2D default]]. The main difference was that her old sweater did not feature a [[cleavage cutout]] in the shape of a heart, nor did it have an "exposed backside":[/wiki_pages/backless_outfit]. Other differences include [[mismatched socks]] that were white and black, a [[red jacket]] rather than a red blanket, long [[red nails]], no [[arrows]] on her person, and a black [[bracelet]] worn on her left arm.

h4. Appearance

She wears a [[white leotard]] or a [[black tube top]] with [[white shorts|white]] [[short shorts]], a [[white jacket|white]] and [[purple jacket|purple]] [[cropped jacket]], [[white gloves|white]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[elbow gloves]], and [[suspenders]] with the word Hentai on it. title: bambietta_basterbine
body:
[[Bleach]] character.

Bambietta Basterbine (バンビエッタ・バスターバイン, Banbietta Basutābain) is a [[Quincy (bleach)|]] and a member of the [[Wandenreich]]'s [[Sternritter]] with the designation "E" - "The Explode". She is an extreme sadist and the self-proclaimed leader of "The Bambies", a loose group of female Sternritter. [spoilers]However, after being zombified by [[Giselle Gewelle]], she displays a far more meek and submissive personality, and is often abused by Giselle. This is implied to be her actual personality, and her sadism is merely a front.[/spoilers]

A young woman with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] and [[blue eyes|dark blue-ish eyes]] in the anime, [[brown eyes|brown]] in the manga.

She wears her [[Wandenreich uniform]] with a [[white jacket|white]] [[military jacket]], [[white headwear|white]] [[peaked cap|peaked]] [[military hat]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white footwear|white]] [[knee boots]] and a [[black belt|black]] [[heart belt|heart-shaped belt]].
other_names: バンビエッタ・バスターバイン

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]], she has [[long hair|long]] [[green hair|green]] [[streaked hair]] with her [[sidelocks]] tied in up.

title: floette_(eternal)
body:
Eternal Flower Floette, a special form of [[Floette]].

Key characteristics:

* Blue underside and eyelashes
* Red rings around its ears
* It holds a red flower with 6 petals (3 large and 3 small)

[[az_(pokemon)|AZ]]'s Eternal Flower Floette has a role in the story of [i][[pokemon_xy|Pokémon XY]][/i]. Additionally, Eternal Flower Floette exists in the game data as a normal Pokémon with its base stat total being 1 less than that of [[Florges]], but it is not obtainable by any means.

body: Yellow color variant of the [[Yoshi]]s, introduced in [i][[Super Mario World]][/i]. Has the innate ability to stomp the ground and create earthquakes if he has any shell color in his mouth.

title: blue_yoshi
body: Blue color variant of the [[Yoshi]]s, introduced in [i][[Super Mario World]][/i]. Has the innate ability to sprout wings and fly if he has any shell color in his mouth.

title: peppino_spaghetti
body:
The main character of [[Pizza Tower]]. Peppino is an Italian [[chef]] running a struggling pizzeria when he is suddenly confronted by [[Pizzaface]], who builds the titular tower next to his pizzeria and threatened to destroyed it. Fueled by both anger and fear, Peppino stormed the tower to save his business.

Due to the guest appearance of [[Mort (mort the chicken)|Mort the Chicken]] from the 2000 PS1 game of the [[mort the chicken|same name]], who is prominently featured in one of the level's title card. This inspired a wave of title card art featuring Peppino [[crossover|crossing over]] with various other properties.
other_names: ペッピーノ・スパゲッティ

title: pizza_tower
body:
Indie video game inspired by the [[Wario Land]] and [[Jazz Jackrabbit]] series, in development by [[McPig]] since 2018, released in 2023.

Features [[Peppino Spaghetti]] climbing the titular tower, with the aid of [[Gustavo (pizza tower)|]] & [[Brick (pizza tower)|]]. Each level features a set of five Toppins to collect ([[Mushroom Toppin (pizza tower)|Mushroom]], [[Cheese Toppin (pizza tower)|Cheese]], [[Tomato Toppin (pizza tower)|Tomato]], [[Sausage Toppin (pizza tower)|Sausage]], and [[Pineapple Toppin (pizza tower)|Pineapple]]) and [[Gerome (pizza tower)|]] the Janitor. Each floor of the tower features several levels, ending with reaching [[Pillar John]] and rushing back to the start, and a boss fight, going up against [[Pepperman]], [[The Vigilante]], [[The Noise]], [spoiler][[Fake Peppino]][/spoiler], and [[Pizzaface]] respectively, with each boss being accessed after collecting a certain amount of Toppins and paying [[Mr. Stick (pizza tower)|]] for access. Each level has relatively distinct themes and gimmicks, with some reoccurring elements, including enemies such as [[Forknight]]s or [[Stupid Rat (pizza tower)|]]s. Each floor has at least one secret room in the hub area, one featuring the Noise's girlfriend, [[Noisette (pizza tower)|]]. 

The second floor features the level Fun Farm, which involves special guest [[Mort (mort the chicken)|Mort the Chicken]] from the 2000 PS1 game of the [[mort the chicken|same name]], who is prominently featured in that level's title card. This inspired a wave of title card art featuring Peppino crossing over with various other properties.

title: q_(james_bond)
body: A [[james bond (series)|James Bond]] character.

title: james_bond
body:
The main character of the [[james bond (series)|James Bond series]]. He is a secret agent for the [[england|British]] Secret Intelligence Service (MI6) as part of their double-o agents program (thus his codename - 007).

Throughout the James Bond movies, the character has been played by several actors including [[Sean Connery]] (1962–1967, 1971, 1983), David Niven (1967), George Lazenby (1969), Roger Moore (1973–1985), Timothy Dalton (1987–1989), Pierce Brosnan (1995–2002) and [[Daniel Craig]] (2006–2021).

title: paloma_(james_bond)
body: [b]Paloma[/b] ([b]"Dove"[/b]) is a fictional female character from [[James Bond (series)]]. She first appeared in the [[No Time To Die]] film from 2021 and is played by [[Ana de Armas]].

title: massachusetts
body: The Commonwealth of Massachusetts is a state in the New England region of the [[United States]] of America. It was one of the first thirteen states in the Union, with the official history going back to 1620 during the foundation of the Plymouth Colony. The Commonwealth of Massachusetts is home to over seven million people and the capital and most populous city is [[Boston]].

title: p2000_(sweetheart_hunter)_(girls'_frontline)
body:
[[P2000 (girls' frontline)|]]'s first skin from [[Girls' Frontline]], as part of the 'Phantom Thief Artistry' skin collection from 2024.

She wears a [[red-framed eyewear|red]] [[domino mask]], a [[red leotard]] under a [[black corset]] and a [[white skirt|white]] [[showgirl skirt]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]]. She may possess a golden [[cane]] with a [[diamond (gemstone)|]] atop it.

title: rasputin_(fate)
body: Alter-Ego Pseudo Servant who inhabits the body of [[Kotomine Kirei]]. This tag refers to him in his Father Kotomine persona, seen during the second major story arc of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. He was eventually released as a playable Alter Ego-class Servant for the 2023 New Years event, under his full name [b]Grigori Rasputin[/b]. He also incorporates elements of "Azi Dahaka":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zahhak and "Bahloo":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bahloo.
other_names: グレゴリー・ラスプーチン(Fate)

title: halo
body:
A bright ring or circle of light typically hovering above or traditionally behind the head that either symbolizes purity or to denote that the character is an [[angel]] or [[icon (religion)|saint]]. This tag applies generally to all kinds of halos which hover over one's head, such as a [[mechanical halo]], not just those that are considered traditional - for such halos only, see [[traditional halo]].

Currently, the most common use of halos on Danbooru are in [[Blue Archive]] due to the abundance of students with unique halos hovering over their heads, which symbolize each individual's personality and their citizenship in the academic city of Kivotos.

Not to be confused with the optical phenomenon caused by ice crystals in the atmosphere surrounding the sun or moon, forming a halo (see [b]External Links[/b]), or halo-like artifacts of light caused by bright light sources interacting with the camera lens. The latter is a [[lens flare]].

For the video game, see [[Halo (series)|]].

h4. See also

h5. Type
* [[broken halo]]
* [[glitched halo]]
* [[crescent halo]]
* [[cross halo]]
* [[dark halo]] (a black/“corrupted”) halo)
* [[double halo]]
* [[drawn halo]]
* [[faded halo]]
* [[fake halo]]
* [[flaming halo]]
* [[glowing halo]]
* [[liquid halo]]
* [[mechanical halo]]
* [[melting halo]]
* [[ophanim halo]]
* [[rectangular halo]]
* [[spiked halo]]
* [[star halo]]
* [[traditional halo]] (ring shape with no additions)
* [[winged halo]]

h5. Action/Position
* [[halo behind head]] (or "vertical halo")
* [[halo removed]]
* [[holding halo]]
* [[no halo]]
* [[tilted halo]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Halo (optical phenomenon)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halo_(optical_phenomenon)]
* "Wikipedia: Halo (religious iconography)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Halo_(religious_iconography)]

title: wardrobe_malfunction
body:
Failure of an article of clothing, such as a bra slipping or fabric tearing, that exposes some or all of one's private parts.

Not to be confused with [[accidental exposure]], in which the article of clothing does not fail, nor does the person wear it incorrectly, but they are exposed by some external factor, such as [[wind lift]].

Amusingly, the phrase was originally coined as a public relations fig leaf for what was really a case of [[assisted exposure]].

h4. See also

* [[accidental exposure]]
* [[assisted exposure]]
* [[dressing]] / [[undressing]]
* [[nipple slip]]
* [[one breast out]]
* [[popped button]]
* [[torn clothes]]
** [[tearing clothes]]
* [[wardrobe error]] - for when clothes are worn incorrectly, but not malfunctioning
* [[oversized clothes]] / [[undersized clothes]]
* [[unlikely accident]]

title: star_wars:_the_phantom_menace
body:
[b]Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace[/b] is a 1999 American epic space opera film written and directed by [[George Lucas]]. It is the fourth film in the [[Star Wars]] film series, the first film of the prequel trilogy and the first in chronological order.

Set 32 years before the original trilogy, (13 years before the formation of the Galactic Empire), during the era of the Galactic Republic, the plot follows Jedi Master [[Qui-Gon Jinn]] and his apprentice [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] as they try to protect Queen [[Padme Amidala]] of Naboo in hopes of securing a peaceful end to an interplanetary trade dispute. Joined by [[Anakin Skywalker]]—a young [[slave]] with unusually strong natural powers of the Force—they simultaneously contend with the mysterious return of the [[Sith]]. 

The film was produced by Lucasfilm and distributed by [[20th century studios|20th Century Fox]].
 [[Star Wars: Attack of the Clones|Attack of the Clones]] (2002) and [[Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith|Revenge of the Sith]] (2005) followed The Phantom Menace, rounding out the Star Wars prequel trilogy.
other_names: スターウォーズエピソード1

title: alter_servant
body:
Theoretical fan-designed [[dark persona]] version of a character who has been (theoretically) corrupted by the mud of the Fuyuki Holy Grail from [[Fate/Stay Night]], similar to canon examples like [[Dark Sakura]] or [[Saber Alter]]. Fan examples of "alters" include [[Archer Alter (fate)|]], [[Lancer Alter]] (later made [[cu_chulainn_alter_(fate)|canon]] in [[Fate/Grand Order]]), or the "Sabatsugu" version of [[Emiya Kiritsugu]] (not to be confused with [[Emiya Kiritsugu (Assassin)]]).

Common traits of an Alter version of a character include [[white hair]], [[red eyes]] or [[yellow eyes]], [[pale skin]], and visible red veins of [[corruption]]. Alter characters will also typically be dressed in an [[alternate costume]] with darker colors or stripes of black and red.

In the later installments, the concept of Alter Servant is expanded to include any servant that were corrupted or have their saint graph altered to some degree without the Holy Grail involved. Notable examples include [[Atalanta Alter (fate)|]] who is essentially an alternate noble phantasm form of [[Atalanta (fate)|]] and retains the same personality.

The opposite of this is [[Lily Servant]].

Not to be used for official Alters, which include:

* [[Archer Alter (fate)|]]
* [[Arjuna Alter (fate)|]]
* [[arthur pendragon alter (fate)|Arthur Pendragon Alter]]
* [[artoria pendragon (lancer alter) (fate)|Artoria Pendragon Lancer Alter]]

title: visor_cap
body:
A type of capless [[hat]], consisting of an eyeshade and something to fasten it to the head, such as a rim or an elastic strap.

Not to be confused with [[peaked cap]], which is associated with [[police uniform|police]] or [[military uniform]].

h4. See also

* [[tennis uniform]]
* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

* "Wikipedia: Sports visor":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sports_visor
